Info Source: Attorney General Abbott Secures $1.5 Million in Credit Insurance Premium Refunds, States News Service, December 10, 2007 (via Nexis).

Agency: Connecticut Securities and Business Investments Division

Notes: Link is to summary of Order, suspended or shared liability for penalties not available.

Description: ProEquities agreed to pay $435,000 to a group of states to resolve alleged violations of rules regarding the licensing of investment advisors.

Company: Protective Life Insurance Company et al.
Description: Protective Life and affiliated companies agreed to pay $350,000 to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
FINRA fined 25 broker-dealers a total of $2,145,000 for failures related to their completion of FINRA's (then NASD's) firm self-assessment of mutual fund breakpoint discount compliance.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.
